instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Liquid Damage Wont run off Battery or Charge.
threads.message:
I have a MacBook Air "13, Early 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A

 Came in still wet, opened it right up and unplugged the battery. Gave it an ultrasonic bath right away followed up with an alcohol bath, heat pad and left overnight.

 Reassembled it the next day. Boots up on charger only, however it does see the battery and charge light goes from green to orange.


 Battery Status shows Replace Battery, however it's @ %68.   So we see the battery, and it acts like it's charging it.  If I unplug the charger it shuts right off so safe to say it's not at all running on battery.

 I traced <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and have 8.57 @ all my points.

 <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> @ 3.41

 Had corrosion at these points :

 ( Top of Board )

<CAPACITOR>C7797</CAPACITOR>, L7701, XW7720

J6100

 Above and just right of Shield SL0402 Near TP1GND

 ( Bottom of Board )


Good amount between <CHIP>U5600</CHIP> and <CHIP>U5601</CHIP>

Around <CAPACITOR>C5440</CAPACITOR> over the ground and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>



 Board cleaned up well, as I received it still wet.

Looking for some direction to figure what I need to do next.

 I'll attach photos if it helps ?

 Thanks in advance !

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Liquid Damage Wont run off Battery or Charge.
threads.message: Have you tried a new battery??? This sounds like a bad battery to me.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Liquid Damage Wont run off Battery or Charge.
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stuck on 8.57V, battery is not charging.
You receive "Replace Now" alert for battery, which usually means bad battery.
Magsafe light stays orange even without battery connected, as normal behaviour for all MacBooks since 2013.
It switch to green ONLY when battery is fully charged 100%.

Try known good battery (even old), before wasting more time on it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Liquid Damage Wont run off Battery or Charge.
threads.message:
Sounds like a plan. I'll give it a go and report back.

 Thanks for your time !

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Liquid Damage Wont run off Battery or Charge.
threads.message:
I'll be dammed..   Must have shorted the battery when all the fun happen.

 Battery for the win !  All is well.

 Thanks !
